captions.text: Hey everyone! I'm Mindy from CuteGirlsHairstyles, and today I am here with Miss Kamri,
and we're going to show you how to do a hairstyle that we are calling Double Dutchback!
So, this hairstyle I saw an Heidi Klum,
on America's Got Talent, she wore this a couple weeks ago,
and immediately fell in love with it! I noticed it when she wore it,
and then my cute dad, who's always looking for hairstyles for me, as well,
sent me an email with these close-up pictures of it {the style}
so that I could mimic it. And he's like, "Do you have this one already?"
So, this one's for you dad, because, it is thanks to him that we got these great pictures,
and then been able to do this hairstyle!
Now, to begin this hairstyle, I've done a deep part.
And you can't really see it right now, because I have a lot of her hair combed over to one side.
and secured out of the way, and I'll show you why.
We've already created our first section. You can see the part line goes
kind of from the end of her eyebrow, straight back a little bit, then curves down,
and then wraps around the base of her neck right here, just a little bit.
And, it's maybe an inch, inch and a half, between her ear and the part line.
So, that's our first section. So I've combed everything else clear over to the right side,
and secured it out of the way already. Now, we're going to start...
Turn your head this way for me, just a little. Thanks!
By... I'm actually going to take, because her hair is pretty fine, I'm going to take some, um, spray wax,
and just spray it through her hair a little bit.
It is just going to add a little bit more texture to it, and hold the grip of the braid a little bit better for me.
If you already have some natural curl in your hair, you're not going to need that spray wax, and it'll hold just fine.
You are going to divide it into three sections, and begin a Dutch braid.
So, go ahead and just keep doing a Dutch braid. You're going to just add in your small pieces as you go along.
And you're just going to keep the braid centered, right in the middle of the part we already created.
And we're going to go back and up over her ear,
This hairstyle is great for many, many, many hair textures.
You can do this on straight hair. You can do it on really, really curly hair.
It would look really super cute in even Paisley's hair.
So, any of the hair textures are an option for this hairstyle.
And it is pretty quick and simple, too!
So, when we get to this point,
You have the option to stop right here above her ear, if you are in a hurry
and you are using this as a Back-to-School Hairstyle.
You can just stop and secure it right there, and just have a little braid back.
Heidi Klum had it braided all the way down, so that's what I am going to continue to do.
So, I'm just going to continue to work down this part line.
{This took 30 seconds}
When you get down to the nape of the neck,
you're going to turn the braid a little bit more again, and kind of go to the side.
Try to turn her so that you guys can see really well.
We're going to take it right along the base of her hairline.
Keeping it nice and secure.
with just the hair that we've already left out.
And when we run out of hair,
I'm going to just braid it a little bit more, as a regular braid,
and then secure it with an elastic, right up in here.
So, we don't want the braids to show when we are all finished.
We want it to just look like her hair is down.
Now, we are going to come back and let this hair out,
that we had secured from before.
And, we are going to go back and re-part her hairline.
So, I'm going to find where her natural part line is...
right, maybe in here...
Yeah, that's probably pretty good! And then I'm going to take it down,
I'm going to try and mimic the one underneath that I have already done.
So I'm going to try to do, like, kind of an "S" shape through here,
and go down. And you may have to adjust it a little bit, and play with it as you go along.
You can see, I haven't gone quite wide enough.
So, we'll go down like this, and over, until we like the shape of the part line we create.
OK, and when you get it all parted the way you like it,
go ahead and secure it with an elastic on that side again.
And then you're going to go back to the top,
and, again, you can put a little spray wax in,
to help hold those pieces in place, if you need to.
Go back up to the top, pick up your three sections, and start your second Dutch Braid.
And, then, just continue to braid down this,
until you have a completed Dutch braid following your part line.
{This took 1 minute to do.}
And then just go ahead and form it all into a regular braid.
You could even, at this point, secure them together if you wanted to.
You could take out the original elastic, and just re-connect them together.
Like that!
And, you're going to take out the hair we left, down.
And it's going to fall and cover the large majority of that back.
And...
fall in the front, and be really pretty.
So, it's just going to look like, this really fun...
very, different-looking hairstyle.
Like, I think it has, kind of, and edgy look to it, and I LOVE that!
Because it is, kind of, like, half all slicked on one side, and then not on the other!
And, we are all finished brushing out the rest of her hair!
We'll do the final spin...
It's like...
BAM! Surprise!
It's not all soft and down!
I love it!
Anyway, thank you to Heidi Klum for the inspiration!
Now, leave a comment below telling me what shows you guys watch on TV, that you think have great hair!
And, if you'd love to see me do some of the styles from those shows!
And, we will see you guys next Sunday! Bye, guys! Bye!
Click here to SUBSCRIBE!
Click above to watch our Bubble Fishtail Braid tutorial!
Thank you from CuteGirlsHairstyles!
Kamri, 10 years ago! She was our major milk drinker! Listen!

title: How to Create a Double Dutchback | Heidi Klum Hairstyles
